The Bezos Mandate

Outline (The Bezos Mandate)

  1. The Bezos Mandate [3]
  2. Network Effect [5]
  3. Digital Reprogramming for Leaders [2]
  4. Conclusions [1]
The Bezos Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Evangelization: Scaling the API Practice

(3) Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Rules [https://gist.github.com/chitchcock/1281611]

  • Famous small set of SOA design rules
    • Teams must expose functionality through services
    • Communication happens only through service interfaces
    • There are no hard guidelines for service design
    • Internal/external service is a matter of policy, not one of design
  • Going against the let's pick a technology spirit of old-school SOA


The Bezos Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Evangelization: Scaling the API Practice

(4) Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Consequences

  • With more freedom comes more responsibility
    • Monitoring and metrics are necessary for finding root causes
    • All APIs must be hardened against DoS attacks
    • Automated QA is necessary to really understand service health
    • Services must be documented and registered so that they can be discovered
    • Debugging becomes harder because of service dependencies
  • Sophisticated tooling required to manage the API landscape
  • Much easier in today's technology landscape than 20 years ago


The Bezos Mandate Erik Wilde (@dret): Evangelization: Scaling the API Practice

(5) API First [https://www.apiscene.io/product/api-first-the-essence-of-digital-transformation/]: Everything is an API

  • Jeff Bezos' Mandate [Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Rules [https://gist.github.com/chitchcock/1281611] (1)] focuses on API products
    • Loose coupling means to look at products as APIs
    • All dependencies have to be designed and built as APIs
  • API products are built by thinking about interactions
    1. The API is the first UI
    2. APIs are designed before anything is implemented
    3. APIs are the primary means of team communications


Network Effect

(7) APIs Need Critical Mass



Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Evangelization: Scaling the API Practice

(8) Size Matters: The Network Effect



Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Evangelization: Scaling the API Practice

(9) Why? The Network Effects Needs a Network

  • It's ineffective to do digital transformation light
  • ROI grows more than linear because options grow more than linear
  • Find lighthouse projects to demonstrate ROI and potential


Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Evangelization: Scaling the API Practice

(10) What? The Platform is a Team Effort

  • Everybody consumes and contributes building blocks
  • Nobody assumes that their product cannot be reused or improved
  • Making APIs the Default [http://dret.net/lectures/api-world-2021/] is effective but not always possible


Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Evangelization: Scaling the API Practice

(11) How? Collaboration Needs Design and Discipline

  • API products are essential as digital building blocks
  • API product thinking is important for designing good building blocks
  • Everybody is building for everybody else


Digital Reprogramming for Leaders

Outline (Digital Reprogramming for Leaders)

Digital Reprogramming for Leaders Erik Wilde (@dret): Evangelization: Scaling the API Practice

(13) Expanding the Opportunity Space

  • Understanding API Business Models [API Business Value: How to Make Money with APIs; API Business Models (1)] expands the opportunity space
  • Taking time to discuss all models establishes a shared foundation


Digital Reprogramming for Leaders Erik Wilde (@dret): Evangelization: Scaling the API Practice

(14) Developing Digital Goals

  • Establishing a Business Capability Model is a first step for improved composability
  • Aligning APIs with capabilities turns them into digital building blocks
  • Establishing and managing an API portfolio for better visibility and reuse
